member.name: T:Castle.Core.CastleComponentAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is usefull only when you want to register all components on an assembly as a batch process. By doing so, the batch register will look for this attribute to distinguish components from other classes.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.LifestyleAttribute
member.summary: Base for Attributes that want to express lifestyle chosen by the component.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.InterceptorAttribute
member.summary: Used to declare that a component wants interceptors acting on it.

member.name: M:Castle.Core.InterceptorAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs the InterceptorAttribute pointing to a key to a interceptor

member.name: M:Castle.Core.InterceptorAttribute.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs the InterceptorAttribute pointing to a service

member.name: T:Castle.Core.SingletonAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the target components wants a singleton lifestyle.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.TransientAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the target components wants a transient lifestyle.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.PerThreadAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the target components wants a per thread lifestyle.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.PooledAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the target components wants a pooled lifestyle.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.CustomLifestyleAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the target components wants a custom lifestyle.

member.name: P:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IInvocation.MethodInvocationTarget
member.summary: Returns the method on the target of invocation, which can be for example the method defined on an interface, if dealing with an interface proxy

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInterceptor
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented by any component that wishes to be referenced as interceptor.
member.remarks: This interface will be replaced by IInterceptor

member.name: M:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInterceptor.Intercept(Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation,System.Object[])
member.summary: Method invoked by the proxy in order to allow the interceptor to do its work before and after the actual invocation.
member.param: The invocation holds the details of this interception
member.returns: The return value of this invocation

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation
member.summary: Supply information about the current method invocation.
member.remarks: This interface will be replaced by IInvocation

member.name: M:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation.Proceed(System.Object[])
member.summary: The Proceed go on with the actual invocation.

member.name: P:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation.Proxy
member.summary: The proxy instance.

member.name: P:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation.InvocationTarget
member.summary: The target of this invocation, which usually is the instance of the class being proxy. You might change the target, but be aware of the implications.

member.name: P:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation.Method
member.summary: The Method being invoked.

member.name: P:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IMethodInvocation.MethodInvocationTarget
member.summary: The Method being invoked on the target.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Interceptor.IOnBehalfAware

member.summary: Implementors should perform any initialization logic.

member.summary: Implementors should perform any initialization/clean up.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Logging.ConsoleLogger
member.summary: The Logger sending everything to the standard output streams. This is mainly for the cases when you have a utility that does not have a logger to supply.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Logging.LevelFilteredLogger
member.summary: The Level Filtered Logger class. This is a base clase which provides a LogLevel attribute and reroutes all functions into one Log method.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Logging.ILogger
member.summary: Manages logging.
member.remarks: This is a facade for the different logging subsystems. It offers a simplified interface that follows IOC patterns and a simplified priority/level/severity abstraction.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.Logging.StreamLogger
member.summary: The Stream Logger class. This class can stream log information to any stream, it is suitable for storing a log file to disk, or to a MemoryStream for testing your components.
member.remarks: This logger is not thread safe.

member.name: T:Castle.Core.LifestyleType
member.summary: Enumeration used to mark the component's lifestyle.

member.name: F:Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Undefined
member.summary: No lifestyle specified.

member.name: F:Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Singleton
member.summary: Singleton components are instantiated once, and shared between all clients.

member.name: F:Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Thread
member.summary: Thread components have a unique instance per thread.

member.name: F:Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Transient
member.summary: Transient components are created on demand.

member.name: F:Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Pooled
member.summary: Optimization of transient components that keeps instance in a pool instead of always creating them.

member.name: F:Castle.Core.LifestyleType.Custom
